intro: Ibatia pucara, commonly known as the Andean beauty, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique and hardy plants.
